column3: Code review ACK df7a0ab34606c6203eb53ff4061f656293ab0f7f. Code change looks fine, but I think this is a bad approach for a few reasons:\n\n- The approach is more complicated than it needs to be. There is no need to have a macro-wrapped fake lock class just to assert a mutex is locked. The ASSERT_CAPABILITY annotation literally exists for this purpose.
